Nick Rollins

Research Projects

My fascination with research started in college. Here are a couple of research projects I've worked on.

Still in progress

Here's a quick overview of what I'll be covering:

  • My experience as a lab manager at Missouri S&T's UX research lab (LITE).
  • An experiment I designed and led where participants played Tetris at diferent levels while wearing an EEG headset. We monitored brain activity to better understand the concept of 'Flow'. You can read the research paper here: Understanding The Psychophysiological Correlates of User Experience in Online Gaming
  • An experiment I designed and led where participants attempted to solve a murder-mystery by using a prototype that we called 'the Reason Support System.' You can read the research paper here: Reason Support Systems: Improving Conceptualization by Structuring Information in Logic Webs

Still interested?

Shoot me an email (below) and I'll let you know when this article is published!

Get in Touch

I'm always open to meeting new people, collaborating on projects, or discussing new opportunites. Please feel free to reach out, even if it's just to say 'hello.' You can find me on social media or copy my email address below!
